data.title: E.U. foreign ministers to discuss threat from Islamic State
data.meta_description: Brussels, Dec 15 (EFE). — The foreign ministers of the European Union, E.U., are set to discuss on Monday the threat from the Islamic State, IS, jihadist group in Syria and Iraq, among other international issues.E.U. sources said that the discussion will help the 28 member countries to prepare a global strategy for that region.The E.U. is […]
data.text:
Brussels, Dec 15 (EFE). — The foreign ministers of the European Union, E.U., are set to discuss on Monday the threat from the Islamic State, IS, jihadist group in Syria and Iraq, among other international issues.

E.U. sources said that the discussion will help the 28 member countries to prepare a global strategy for that region.

The E.U. is committed to supporting efforts to reduce the violence resulting from the clashes between the Syrian regime, led by President Bashar alAssad, and the opposition, as a basis for a Syrianled political process leading to a transition, the sources added.

Moreover, other diplomatic sources said that during the meeting the E.U. foreign ministers will condemn violence and abuses and ask for the parties to the conflict to respect human rights, along with finding a political solution.

The European Union has collected $3.7 billion to assist Syrians in their country and neighboring states where they live as refugees.

Regarding Iraq, the E.U. has given its full support to Prime Minister Haidar alAbadi’s efforts to carry out policies that would lead to national reconciliation.

During the meeting, the union is also expected to address the threat of terrorism, as well as supporting the efforts of the U.S.led international coalition fighting the IS.

The foreign ministers are to discuss other political and security crises including the situation in Libya, the western Balkans and will adopt some conclusions for BosniaHerzegovina in order to move forward with the reform process that could bring the country into the European Union.
